title: The Empirical Content of Bayesianism. (arXiv:2109.07007v4 [econ.TH] UPDATED)
abstract: This paper characterizes the conditions under which the observed beliefs of a group of agents are consistent with Bayesian updating. Beliefs are consistent with Bayesianism if they arise from the application of Bayes' rule given some subjective distribution for the state and the signals agents observe between periods. The paper's main finding is that beliefs are consistent with Bayesianism if and only if the mean of the distribution of posteriors is uniformly absolutely continuous with respect to the prior. Furthermore, the paper shows that the existing results on the empirical content of Bayesianism rely on additional restrictions on permissible subjective distributions, such as the requirement that agents have correct beliefs about the distribution of signals.

translated_title: 贝叶斯主义的经验内容
translated_abstract: 本文研究了一组代理人的观察信念与贝叶斯更新一致的条件。如果信念是从在每个时期代理人观察到的某些主观分布下应用贝叶斯规则得出的，那么这些信念就与贝叶斯主义一致。本文的主要发现是，只有在后验分布的均值在先验分布下是一致绝对连续的情况下，信念才与贝叶斯主义一致。此外，本文还表明，关于贝叶斯主义的经验内容的现有结果依赖于对允许的主观分布的其他限制，例如代理人对信号分布的正确信念要求。
tldr: 这篇论文研究了与贝叶斯主义一致的观察信念条件，发现只有后验分布的均值绝对连续于先验分布时，才满足贝叶斯主义。同时指出现有对贝叶斯主义的经验内容的结果依赖于对主观分布的其他限制。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates the conditions for consistent beliefs with Bayesian updating and finds that beliefs are consistent with Bayesianism only when the mean of the posterior distribution is absolutely continuous with respect to the prior. Additionally, it highlights the dependency of existing results on additional restrictions on subjective distributions in terms of correct beliefs about signal distributions.
